content: Admittedly, not a swole woman, but…I think HIIT has convinced many people that lifting weights while you’re out of breath is the norm. Or that “hardcore” is the only way to get fit. HIIT can be very useful, but at the moment it’s doing more harm than good (at least in NYC!). No one at the gym is setting personal records in the squat or deadlift after doing 25 burpees. If you’re starting out lifting, save the “hardcore” mentality for the boutique fitness joints (and if you really want to lift weights, I don’t see how you can do HIIT more than once a week).
